page.title: 13Sparham Industry (1)
page.content: Although a small village, there is no lack of private enterprise in Sparham. There are two coalyards, one owned by Mr G.A. Egmore, who buys coal from the E. Midlands and Wales and delivers in a 10 mile radius round Sparham. The second coal- and wood-yard deals in wood collected from Norfolk and Lincolnshire, this is cut into pit props for coal mines in Mansfield, Leicestershire and Yorkshire. "Travelwide" coaches operate 1 minibus and 6 coaches for private hire; routes range from transporting children in the district to schools in Lyng and Reepham, workers to Matthews turkey factory and trips to the continent. "One-man" industries include a painter and decorator, and the owner of a JCB digger whose work includes drainage digging and excavating the footings for houses.
